title: All About Cameron Diaz’s Surprise Acting Comeback

metadata.excerpt: Lights! Cameron Diaz! Action! Eight years after the megastar retired from making movies, Diaz—whose last major role was in the 2014 Annie remake costarring Jamie Foxx—will reteam with the Oscar winner in Netflix’s upcoming action comedy Back in Action. “I can’t frickin wait,” the actress, 49, wrote on Instagram June 29, the same day Foxx posted audio of a three-way phone call with NFL quarterback Tom Brady, who jokingly offered to give Diaz tips on unretiring successfully.

issue.tocByline: By Eric Andersson With Reporting by Pernilla Cedenheim and Linda Marx

components.//: ====== NOTE: ITALICS DO NOT WORK WITH RUBRICS. SEE BOTTOM FOR STRAPLINE AND WOB EXAMPLES ======

components.text: All About Cameron Diaz’s Surprise Acting Comeback

By Eric Andersson
With reporting by Pernilla Cedenheim and Linda Marx

Lights! Cameron Diaz! Action! Eight years after the megastar retired from making movies, Diaz—whose last major role was in the 2014 Annie remake costarring Jamie Foxx—will reteam with the Oscar winner in Netflix’s upcoming action comedy Back in Action. “I can’t frickin wait,” the actress, 49, wrote on Instagram June 29, the same day Foxx posted audio of a three-way phone call with NFL quarterback Tom Brady, who jokingly offered to give Diaz tips on unretiring successfully.

caption.text:
Best Supporting Husband
“Benji has always been there for Cameron,” a music source says of Madden (right, in 2018).

components.text:
Best Supporting Husband
“Benji has always been there for Cameron,” a music source says of Madden (right, in 2018).

But it was another star—Diaz’s husband, Good Charlotte rocker Benji Madden, 43—who ultimately persuaded the four-time Golden Globe nominee to make another movie. “Benji encouraged her,” according to a family source, who says the timing felt right for Diaz after she accomplished so many other personal and professional goals. When she stepped away from movies (and multimillion-dollar paychecks), the Charlie’s Angels star set out to focus on “parts of my life that I wasn’t touching,” as she put it in an interview last year. Diaz did just that: She wed Madden in 2015, coauthored the healthy-living tome The Longevity Book, launched the wine brand Avaline and welcomed daughter Raddix via surrogate in 2019. Since then motherhood has been her priority. “To have to be on a movie set that takes 14 hours, 16 hours of my day away from my child—I just couldn’t,” she said last year.

caption.text: Diaz with friend and once-again costar Jamie Foxx (in 1999).

components.text: Diaz with friend and once-again costar Jamie Foxx (in 1999).

So not just any project could tear her away from her homelife. The fact that she’d be working with Foxx, with whom she first costarred in the 1999 drama Any Given Sunday, was another draw. “She’s comfortable with Jamie and always has been,” says another insider. Indeed, in her June 29 Instagram post, she wrote to Foxx, “only you could get me back in action.”
‘Cameron never said never about getting back into acting’

Just not full-time. “She doesn’t want acting to overtake her life like it did before,” says a film source, who adds that Back in Action, which has no set release date, was the right movie at the right time. “All the parts fit into place.”
MARC PATRICK/BFA; WORLD OF WONDER/GETTY IMAGES; PHOTOGRAPHER GROUP/SPLASH; ALAMY
